content.raw:
anything that modifies API/ABI has to get in today in order to be part of gazebo6; otherwise it has to wait for gazebo7

as a rule of thumb, if it involves a change to a header file, it has a good chance of changing API/ABI
content.html:
anything that modifies API/ABI has to get in today in order to be part of gazebo6; otherwise it has to wait for gazebo7

as a rule of thumb, if it involves a change to a header file, it has a good chance of changing API/ABI

content.html: I'm confused, isn't that what this pull request is for?

content.html: If we don't get it in today, then it'll have to go into gazebo7

content.html: Oh shoot. I better figure out why those tests are failing. Are we pushing this to a later version of gazebo 6?

update.description: Allows plugins, tools, and events to be built on windows. Fixed dll imports/exports, added windows specfic includes (mostly winsock), and fixed code style to work on windows. Everything could be built if it were linked statically, but this is not what we want. This will be fixed as soon as some circular dependencies are resolved.For now plugin and event libraries are kept as SHARED so that it will build on Linux.
update.title: Fixing windows compilation

update.title: Fixing windows compilation

content.raw:
Putting in this comment so we don't forget. I added this so the freeimage library will be used statically, instead of as a dll import library.
The other option of course is to not use this, and instead provide the dll, which I was able to download and link with. Either option works.
content.html: Putting in this comment so we don't forget. I added this so the freeimage library will be used statically, instead of as a dll import library. The other option of course is to not use this, and instead provide the dll, which I was able to download and link with. Either option works.

No, I can revert it and make sure to put the `#include <Winsock2.h>` in `ImuSensorPlugin.cc`
Or, we can leave it this way, since `Plugins.hh` has the winsock stuff already. Which would be better?
content.html: No, I can revert it and make sure to put the #include <Winsock2.h> in ImuSensorPlugin.cc Or, we can leave it this way, since Plugins.hh has the winsock stuff already. Which would be better?

content.raw:
Code check probably doesn't know about this functionality, and is reporting an error. I can show you how to for it to ignore this problem.

Can't you write this as: `private: std::array<float, 7>cmds{{0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0}};`
content.html:
Code check probably doesn't know about this functionality, and is reporting an error. I can show you how to for it to ignore this problem.

Can't you write this as: private: std::array<float, 7>cmds{{0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0}};
